snippet: The retailer’s 10-year commitment, totaling $50 billion, comes as it is under pressure over its overseas sourcing following a deadly fire in November in Bangladesh.
abstract: Walmart announces that it will increase sourcing of American-made products by $50 billion over the next 10 years; says it will buy more goods already produced in the United States, as well as help vendors return production that has moved overseas; announcement comes as the retailer is under pressure over its overseas sourcing due to a deadly fire in Bangladesh.
lead_paragraph: The retailer’s 10-year commitment, totaling $50 billion, comes as it is under pressure over its overseas sourcing following a deadly fire in November in Bangladesh.

headline.seo: Walmart Plans to Buy More American-Made Goods
headline.main: Walmart Plans to Buy American More Often
headline.print_headline: Walmart Plans to Buy American More Often
